name: ListSlackTeamUsers
description:
Fetches a list of all users in a Slack team.

This tool retrieves a comprehensive list of all users within a specified Slack team. It includes user details and can access email information if the appropriate OAuth scopes are provided.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for paginating through data. Use the `next_cursor` from a previous response to continue.

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: Maximum number of users to return (recommended max is 200 for pagination).

parameters.name: slack_team_id
parameters.description: The encoded team ID to list users from, necessary if an organization-level token is used. Ignored if a workspace-level token is provided.

parameters.name: include_user_locale
parameters.description: Set to true to receive locale information for each user. Default is false.

metadata.description: Arcade Wrapper Tools enabling LLMs to interact with low-level Slack API endpoints.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the `cursor` parameter to a `next_cursor` attribute returned by a previous request's `response_metadata`. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See [pagination](https://docs.slack.dev/apis/web-api/pagination) for more detail.

parameters.name: include_locale
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to receive the locale for users.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached. Providing no `limit` value will result in Slack attempting to deliver you the entire result set. If the collection is too large you may experience `limit_required` or HTTP 500 errors.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Encoded team ID to list users in, required if org token is used.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
